fact.description: The match is underway at Estadio do Maracana.
Eduardo Vargas (Chile) is given an opening but the shot is blocked by a defender.
Mark Geiger signals a throw-in for Spain, close to Chile's area.
Chile have been awarded a corner by Mark Geiger.
Gonzalo Jara's header is off-target for Chile.
Goal kick for Spain at Estadio do Maracana.
Can Spain capitalize from this throw-in deep inside Chile's half?
Chile awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Chile in their own half.
Can Chile get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Spain's half?
Mark Geiger signals a Spain throw-in in Chile's half.
Chile to take a throw-in in Spain territory.
Can Chile get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Spain's half?
Mark Geiger signals a Chile throw-in in Spain's half.
Free kick Spain.
Throw-in for Spain close to the penalty box.
Spain to take a throw-in in Chile territory.
Spain to take a throw-in in Chile territory.
Throw-in for Spain in their own half.
Throw-in for Chile at Estadio do Maracana.
Mauricio Isla for Chile is whistled offside.
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Spain.
Ball goes out of play for a Chile goal kick.
In Rio de Janeiro Spain drive forward through Xabi Alonso. His shot is on target but it's saved.
Mark Geiger blows against Spain's Xabi Alonso for offside.
Throw-in Spain.
Ball safe as Spain is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Spain awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Mark Geiger signals a Chile throw-in in Spain's half.
Throw-in for Spain in their own half.
Ball safe as Spain is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Great play from Charles Aranguiz to set up the goal.
Can Chile get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Spain's half?
Throw-in Spain.

Throw-in for Chile at Estadio do Maracana.
Spain are pushing forward but Xabi Alonso's finish is wide of the goal.
Chile have a goal kick.
Throw-in for Spain in their own half.
Spain awarded a free kick in their own half.
Mark Geiger awards Chile a goal kick.
Spain awarded a free kick in their own half.
Arturo Vidal (Chile) has received a first yellow card.
Free kick Spain.
Diego Costa of Spain gets in a strike, but is off target.
Chile have a goal kick.
Mark Geiger signals a Chile throw-in in Spain's half.
Throw-in for Spain at Estadio do Maracana.
Can Chile get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Spain's half?
Ball goes out of play for a Spain goal kick.
Spain have a dangerous throw-in.
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Chile in their own half.
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Spain.

Ball safe as Spain is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Chile awarded a free kick in their own half.
Throw-in Spain.
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Chile in their own half.
Chile's Alexis Sanchez has run offside.
Chile awarded a free kick in their own half.
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Spain.
Chile needs to be cautious. Spain have an attacking throw-in.
Spain to take a throw-in in Chile territory.
Mark Geiger awards Chile a goal kick.
Free kick Chile.
Spain's Xabi Alonso has been booked in Rio de Janeiro.
Mark Geiger signals a Chile throw-in in Spain's half.
Can Chile get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Spain's half?
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Chile.
Alexis Sanchez with an assist there.
The first-half is over.
Spain awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Mark Geiger signals a Spain throw-in in Chile's half.
2 minutes will be added to the first half in Rio de Janeiro.
Free kick Spain.
Chile awarded a free kick in their own half.
Koke is on a sub for Xabi Alonso for Spain.
Throw-in Spain.
Goal kick for Chile at Estadio do Maracana.
Important block from the Chile defence as Diego Costa fires in a strike for Spain.
Corner awarded to Spain.
In Rio de Janeiro Spain attack through Jordi Alba. The finish is off target, however.
Chile have a goal kick.
Throw-in for Spain in their own half.
Ball goes out of play for a Chile goal kick.
Spain awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Spain to take a throw-in in Chile territory.
Spain's Sergio Ramos gets in a shot on goal at Estadio do Maracana. But the effort is unsuccessful.
Sergio Busquets (Spain) wins the ball in the air but heads wide.
Mark Geiger awards Chile a goal kick.
Can Spain get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Chile's half?
Mark Geiger signals a Spain throw-in in Chile's half.
Throw-in for Chile at Estadio do Maracana.
Play has been interrupted briefly in Rio de Janeiro to check on Charles Aranguiz, who is grimacing with pain.
Play has been resumed.
Can Chile get the ball into an attacking position from this throw-in in Spain's half?
Charles Aranguiz is back on the pitch.
Spain to take a throw-in in Chile territory.
Ball safe as Chile is awarded a throw-in in their half.
Free kick Spain.
Eugenio Mena (Chile) has been booked and must now be careful not to get a second yellow card.
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Chile in their own half.
Throw-in Chile.
Spain make their second substitution with Fernando Torres replacing Diego Costa.
Charles Aranguiz (Chile) does not seem to be able to continue. He is replaced by Felipe Gutierrez.

Chile's Eduardo Vargas is on target but unsuccessful.

Chile's Felipe Gutierrez attacks the ball with his head but his effort fails to hit the target.

Spain awarded a throw-in in their own half.
Chile to take a throw-in in Spain territory.
Throw-in Chile.
Spain make their third substitution with Santi Cazorla replacing Pedro.

Mark Geiger signals a Spain throw-in in Chile's half.

Santi Cazorla gets his shot on target but fails to score for Spain.
Corner awarded to Spain.
Spain have been awarded a corner by Mark Geiger.
Play has been resumed.
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Chile in their own half.
Free kick Spain.
Spain push forward through Iniesta, whose finish on goal is saved.
Jorge Valdivia is on a sub for Eduardo Vargas for Chile.
Corner awarded to Spain.
Spain drive forward and Sergio Ramos gets in a shot. Without netting, however.
Ball safe as Spain is awarded a throw-in in their half.

Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Spain in their own half.
Mark Geiger signals a free kick to Spain.
Chile make their third substitution with Carlos Carmona replacing Arturo Vidal.
Santi Cazorla for Spain drives towards goal at Estadio do Maracana. But the finish is unsuccessful.
Spain have been awarded a corner by Mark Geiger.
Spain are coming forward and Sergio Ramos gets in a strike, it misses the target, however.

Mark Geiger signals a Spain throw-in in Chile's half.
At Estadio do Maracana the fourth official shows that 6 minutes will be added to the second half.
Spain have been awarded a corner by Mark Geiger.
Sergio Ramos (Spain) gets in a strike but the shot is blocked by a defender.
Corner awarded to Spain.
Spain's Jordi Alba gets his shot away but it misses the target.
Ball goes out of play for a Chile goal kick.
Chile awarded a free kick in their own half.
Throw-in for Spain in their own half.
Ball safe as Spain is awarded a throw-in in their half.

The match is over. Final score 0-2.
